app.title: Happy Linux Cheatbook
app.subtitle: Learn Linux commands through stories and metaphors
app.description: Transform commands into memorable characters, parameters into flavor profiles, and pipelines into layered recipes. Make Linux commands stick with visual metaphors and practical examples.

commandRole.title: Commands = Characters
commandRole.detail: Each command has a personality (manager, detective, editor, curator). When you see the command, the character's story comes to mind automatically.

parameterFlavor.title: Parameters = Flavors
parameterFlavor.detail: Flags are like different flavors: -a is ALL (almond), -h is HUMAN-readable (hazelnut). Use taste associations to remember what they do.

pipelineSundae.title: Pipelines = Layered Recipes
pipelineSundae.detail: Each step is a different layer: base (ls), middle filter (grep), top presentation (awk/tar). Combine them to complete the task.

alternativeIngredients.title: Alternatives = Better Tools
alternativeIngredients.detail: When you need more features (performance, colors, JSON), upgrade to modern tools like eza, rg, or jq.

commandStories.title: Command Stories
commandStories.subtitle: Learn both the technical details (history, function) and memorable metaphors (characters, flavors) in one place.

pipelineLab.title: Pipeline Recipes
pipelineLab.subtitle: Combine commands like a recipe: base layer selects data, middle layer filters it, top layer presents results.

systemConcepts.title: System Concepts
systemConcepts.subtitle: Understand Linux systems through real-world analogies: permissions as access badges, processes as running shows, files as organized inventory.
